commit_list.message:
RADEON: fix lockup on start

see debian bug 480312

mkinitramfs: add all usb storage devices

USB storage device is not recognized at boot after kernel upgrade
to 2.6.30.
It seems that the usb-storage module has been split into several mini
modules, which are not copied to the initramfs image.

In my case usb-storage.ko is copied but ums-cypress.ko is not copied.

I've attached a patch against hook-functions that fixes this, by using
copy_modules_dir to copy all the modules in kernel/drivers/usb/storage,
instead of just usb-storage.

I've set the severity to important because my USB storage device also
happens to be the boot device...

Cheers,
Avi

(closes: #543568)

Signed-off-by: maximilian attems <maks@debian.org>

commit_list.message:
BurpFS support (#473)

* monitor/browse: link field added to file entries

* monitor/browse: use "*" as browse directory in order to dump all files

notes:

- we dump the whole path of each entry instead of just its name
- we avoid caching this list

the intended use case for this is a fast one-shot dump of all the file
system entries for use by tools like burpfs

* fixed handling of NULL browse directory
bugfix: restored hardlink path was truncated if longer than target path (#474)
added autoconf/mkinstalldirs, was removed by mistake during autoconf cleanup
added skeleton build procedure for ARM-based android devices

fixed static build on android

must configure with '--disable-libtool --enable-static'
must configure openssl with 'no-shared zlib no-dso'

major autoconf cleanup and upgrade

Use

	autoreconf -Iautoconf/m4

in the project root directory in order to regenerate configure and
src/config.h (no need to copy/move any file)

fixed configure and build error due to missing lockf on android

still need to disable xattr support during configure, and build fails
to generate executables
removed check for setpgrp which cannot be run when cross compiling

removed check for signal (fails on android, even though it's available)

signal is defined in signal.h and it's not included in the test code
generated by configure, so it doesn't get linked in
upgraded autoconf/config.sub, to detect arm-linux-androideabi as valid platform
fixed running of autoreconf -fi
fixed generation of configure and config.h.in by autoreconf

cleaned up some valgrind errors and memory leaks in client mode

The following command

    valgrind --leak-check=full --track-origins=yes ./burp
    
is now almost clean - we still get a memory leak error in SSL_connect
(client.c:202), and there's still reachable memory (allocated by
OpenSSL) when burp exits.
win32: prevent system from entering sleep when idle timer expires
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master'

fixed detection of windows cross tools if burp-cross-tools is a symlink

also created a build target for creating the cross tools symlinks,
otherwise the test -e for gcc fails on the first run (did not bother
to check why)
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master'
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master'
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master'
fixed: autoupgrade fails on windows if autoupgrade_dir has been modified
reworked JSON long file list: escape some chars, use snprintf, don't limit path size

fixed: restore w/ overwrite by linux client and split vss

setup:
win-client is a windows client configured w/ split_vss=1
linux-client os a linux client configured as restore_client for
win-client

problem:
when running the following on linux-client (note the -f option)

burp -C win-client -a r -f -d <restore path> -b <#backup> -r <regexp>

burp first overwrites any existing file at the destination w/ file
data and then overwrites that with the vss footer of each file

fix:
on linux: prevent overwrite of file when considering vss footer in
overwrite_ok
fixed list/verify/restore when regex is long and/or contains colon (windows)
encode_mode: use 'p' instead of 'f' as type char for pipes (S_IFIFO)
fixed win32 warnings in JSON file entry code
Added -j client-side option to format long list as JSON
fixed directory browsing on windows
yet more indentation fixes

commit_list.message:
stability workaround: force -o sync_read

Without sync_read we get random read corruptions from the filesystem
(files in cache are not corrupted, just the data read via FUSE) - it
looks like a bug in libfuse and downwards, but I'm happy with the
workaround as long as it works ...

commit_list.message:
stability workaround: delay hardlink restore

Hit a few cases where a restore failed due to locking if lauched
immediatly after a previous restore (which is exactly what happens
when we restore a hardlink after first restoring its target).
commit_list.repo_description: Burp Filesystem in USErspace

Without sync_read we get random read corruptions from the filesystem
(files in cache are not corrupted, just the data read via FUSE) - it
looks like a bug in libfuse and downwards, but I'm happy with the
workaround as long as it works ...

commit_list.message:
mkinitramfs: add all usb storage devices

USB storage device is not recognized at boot after kernel upgrade
to 2.6.30.
It seems that the usb-storage module has been split into several mini
modules, which are not copied to the initramfs image.

In my case usb-storage.ko is copied but ums-cypress.ko is not copied.

I've attached a patch against hook-functions that fixes this, by using
copy_modules_dir to copy all the modules in kernel/drivers/usb/storage,
instead of just usb-storage.

I've set the severity to important because my USB storage device also
happens to be the boot device...

Cheers,
Avi

(closes: #543568)

Signed-off-by: maximilian attems <maks@debian.org>

commit_list.message:
added support for DBX files larger than 2GB

- updated autoconf
- updated copyright years
- replaced long with int where 32 bit values are used
- use unsigned long long for file size
- use stat to get file size instead of ftell
- remove use of win32 api for file size
- compile with -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 for 64bit file size support
- compilation flags: -Wall -Werror
- fixed file position validity check in dbxread.c

commit_list.message:
mkinitramfs: add all usb storage devices

USB storage device is not recognized at boot after kernel upgrade
to 2.6.30.
It seems that the usb-storage module has been split into several mini
modules, which are not copied to the initramfs image.

In my case usb-storage.ko is copied but ums-cypress.ko is not copied.

I've attached a patch against hook-functions that fixes this, by using
copy_modules_dir to copy all the modules in kernel/drivers/usb/storage,
instead of just usb-storage.

I've set the severity to important because my USB storage device also
happens to be the boot device...

Cheers,
Avi

(closes: #543568)

Signed-off-by: maximilian attems <maks@debian.org>
